etymons.notes: mlḥ. Cf. SL 766 mlḥ (I): to sprinkle salt; Cf.
767 melḥā which is probably better, because the verb is in the second stem?

Infectum-wa.text: Saymiwa qaliyat w kəsdiwo u baṣro, mmalḥiwole, tulanwole bad dane 'People would make qaliyat and pickle (?) the meat, salt it and then put it in containers' (QM 2461)
